description: Describes TCP/RTP Receiver transport parameters. The constraints in this schema are minimum constraints, but may be further constrained at the constraints endpoint. Receivers must support at least the `source_ip`, `interface_ip`, `rtp_enabled` and `source_port` parameters. Receivers supporting RTCP must support parameters prefixed with and `rtcp`.
title: TCP/RTP Receiver Transport Parameters
Receiver Input

source_ip.description: Source IP address of TCP/RTP packets. A null value indicates that the source IP address has not been configured .

interface_ip.description: IP address of the network interface the receiver should use. The receiver should provide an enum in the constraints endpoint, which should contain the available interface addresses. If set to 'auto' in multicast mode the receiver should determine which interface to use for itself, for example by using the routing tables. The behaviour of 'auto' is undefined in unicast mode, and controllers should supply a specific interface address.

source_port.description: Source port for TCP/RTP packets (auto = 5004 by default). A null value indicates that the source port has not been configured

rtcp_source_port.description: source port for RTCP packets (auto = TCP/RTP source + 1 by default)
